Articles.Content: Anybody have any suggestions for side-mounting jettison-able mech-jeb equipped buggies for deployment upon the Mun? Give how the attach points are configured, any attempt I\'ve made at this promptly results in a large explosion. =P
build your rocket and directly attach the buggy to the side of the descent stage.

Well, the idea is I want to be able to jettison the buggies from the lander, with the buggies controlled by Mech-Jebs instead of the command pod. But the way they attach, the mech-jeb ends up intersecting the body of the rocket with... predictable results.
sounds like its a bit too advanced for me, sorry
Try attaching a cart to a radial decoupler, then attaching a small MechJeb module to the cart.

The cart can be used to rotate parts in the VAB. If you then move the rotated part onto some other part of the ship, it stays rotated like that. You can do all kinds of fun things with this. For your case, maybe use it to rotate another cart and mech Jeb upside-down or sideways, and then attach them.
Oh hey, that\'s clever. I\'ll give that a shot.
Oh man it really hates me. I get a buggy to the Mun, drop it off, send the Kerbals home... and the buggy vanishes without a trace. Arrrrgh.

Ew. That sounds frustrating.
